The primary project data managed by datazilla includes Talos performance data. Datazilla web services for individual projects are deployed at specific uri paths: https://datazilla.mozilla.org/stoneridge/ (stoneridge project) and https://datazilla.mozilla.org/talos/ (talos project).

Server: Other.description: For bugs in the minimal server (http://hg.mozilla.org/services/minimal-server/), admin scripts (http://hg.mozilla.org/services/admin-scripts/), dashboards (http://hg.mozilla.org/services/internal_dash/ and http://hg.mozilla.org/services/dashboard/), and the load test (http://hg.mozilla.org/services/loadtest/)

Web Site.description: Anything concerning content on Services web sites. Includes any site under the .services.mozilla.com umbrella, including https://services.mozilla.com, https://account.services.mozilla.com, and http://docs.services.mozilla.com.

Firefox Sync: Cross-client.description: Protocol and storage format issues that affect multiple clients.

Operations: Metrics/Monitoring.description: For all issues regarding metrics and monitoring

Server: Sync.description: For bugs in the Sync Server code (http://hg.mozilla.org/services/sync-server)

Server: Registration.description: For issues with the account registration server (http://hg.mozilla.org/services/reg-server)

Operations.description: For all issues related to Mozilla Services operational issues, including server changes, new hardware deployments, and anything else of the sort.

Bugzilla.description:
The Bugzilla bug-tracking system.
Note: This is not the place to request configuration, permission, or account changes to this installation of Bugzilla (bugzilla.mozilla.org). File such changes under the appropriate component in the bugzilla.mozilla.org product.

User Accounts.description: Anything about managing a user account from the user's perspective. userprefs.cgi, saved queries, creating accounts, changing passwords, logging in, etc.

Administration.description: Administration of a bugzilla installation, including editcomponents.cgi, editgroups.cgi, editkeywords.cgi, editparams.cgi, editproducts.cgi, editusers.cgi, editversions.cgi, sanitycheck.cgi

Testing Suite.description: The Bugzilla Test Suite, for finding problems with Bugzilla.

Bugzilla-General.description: Anything that doesn't fit in the other components, or spans multiple components.

Dependency Views.description: Viewing trees of dependent bugs, either as text or graphically. showdependencytree.cgi, showdependencygraph.cgi

WebService.description: For issues and bugs in the WebService interface. xmlrpc.cgi, Bugzilla/WebService/*.pm

Extensions.description:
Issues related to the Bugzilla extensions system. This is for bugs about the extensions system or extensions that ship with Bugzilla (such as BmpConvert or the Example extension). Bugs about third-party extensions should not be filed here--
usually third-party extensions have their own bug tracker.

Email Notifications.description: Anything to do with email sent by Bugzilla about bugs. Bugzilla/BugMail.pm

Bug Import/Export & Moving.description: Importing bugs into Bugzilla, exporting bugs from Bugzilla, and moving bugs between Bugzillas. importxml.pl

Database.description: General issues with the database interface drivers for Bugzilla. End-user facing bugs should almost never go here. Compatibility issues that affect one database but not another should go here. Driver issues found by developers that affect database access should go here. Everything else should generally go in some other appropriate component.

Documentation.description: The bugzilla documentation, including anything in the docs/ directory and The Bugzilla Guide.

Whining.description: Periodic mailed reports from Bugzilla. whine.pl, editwhines.cgi

bugzilla.org.description: The Bugzilla Project website (http://www.bugzilla.org/) and issues with any mailing lists served under the bugzilla.org domain. This component does not include The Bugzilla Guide.

User Interface.description:
General issues having to do with the user interface. This includes both presentation (how it looks) and behavior (how it works) but not functionality (what it does), which should be filed in a function-specific component like <cite>Email Notifications</cite> or in <cite>Bugzilla-General</cite>. Examples of bugs you might file here include <q>column label "Pri" is confusing</q> and <q>take anonymous users to the simple query page by default</q> but not <q>need way to filter for requests with no requestee</q>.

As a general rule, bugs that affect only a single Bugzilla web page or can be fixed with changes just to templates probably go in this component, while bugs that affect multiple pages or fixes to Perl code probably go somewhere else.

Attachments & Requests.description: For problems with attachment creation/management and request creation/management. <tt>attachment.cgi</tt>, <tt>request.cgi</tt>

Incoming Email.description: Everything related to bug creation and editing by email, using email_in.pl (or the contrib/bug_email scripts in old versions of Bugzilla).

Creating/Changing Bugs.description: Creating, changing, and viewing bugs. enter_bug.cgi, post_bug.cgi, show_bug.cgi, process_bug.cgi

QA Test Scripts.description: Bugs about missing or broken automatic test scripts used by the Bugzilla QA team should come here. This includes all Selenium, RPC and configuration scripts located at http://bzr.mozilla.org/bugzilla/qa/. For bugs related to the test suite released with Bugzilla, see the "Testing Suite" component.

Installation & Upgrading.description: The installation process of Bugzilla. This includes checksetup.pl and whatever else it evolves into

Query/Bug List.description: Anything to do with searching for bugs and viewing the buglists. query.cgi and buglist.cgi

Firefox.description: Firefox Desktop, the Mozilla Foundation's web browser. (more info)

Tabbed Browser.description: For problems in the browser tab features or problems with the widget itself.

Toolbars and Customization.description:
Bugs and feature requests for Firefox toolbars. This includes
toolbar customization.

Panorama.description: Bugs and feature requests for Panorama, formerly known as TabCandy.

Developer Tools: Source Editor.description: This component is responsible for the code editor and wraps the Orion editor in an API.

Location Bar.description: For bugs in the Firefox "Smart Location Bar" UI element, including the bookmark and history autocomplete matching behavior.

File Handling.description: For issues dealing with helper applications, and guessing Content Types when they aren't specified/known (ftp:, file:, jar:, but generally not http:). This component does not cover: backend networking issues, such as those covered by Networking: FTP or Networking: File, nor does it cover the Download Manager which has its own component in the Toolkit product.

Theme.description: Bugs and requests for enhancements or changes to the default theme that ships with Firefox (use the OS target to indicate Windows, Mac, or Linux theme).

Developer Tools: Graphic Commandline and.description: The Graphic Command line and Global Developer Toolbar.

Keyboard Navigation.description: Keyboard shortcut navigation in Firefox's user interface

Page Info Window.description: For issues with the Page Info window.

Session Restore.description: For bugs in Firefox's session restore functionality, including the undo close tab feature.

Developer Tools.description:
For bugs relating to developer tools within the Firefox web
browser. This includes developer-related APIs and front-end features.

Security.description:
For app-level security bugs.

If the problem relates to underlying components (PSM, NSS, Core, Toolkit) then please file it in the appropriate product instead of here.

SocialAPI.description: Social has become an integral part of the Web experience, and that's driving the need for social touch points in the browser. This component covers all pieces of UI and platform work to integrate the social experience into Firefox.

General.description: For bugs in Firefox which do not fit into other more specific Firefox components

Disability Access.description: Accessibility compliance bugs in Firefox: screen readers, magnifier tools support, user interface bugs affecting on disabled people experience.

PDF Viewer.description: For bugs related to Firefox's built-in PDF viewing capabilities (also known as pdf.js).

Developer Tools: Style Editor.description: For issues with the Style Editor within Firefox developer tools

Help Documentation.description:
Inaccurate information and typos in Firefox's built-in help documentation.

Note: problems with the Help Viewer itself should be filed in the Help Viewer component of the Toolkit product.

Downloads Panel.description: For issues with the Downloads Panel, the new download manager of Firefox that lives in the navigation toolbar.

Web Apps.description: Bugs related to the Web Apps integration in Firefox

Extension Compatibility.description: Version level or extension problems or Gecko problems that cause extensions not to work. Also home to INVALID bugs where a malfunctioning extension has broken Firefox.

Build Config.description: For bugs and feature requests in the Firefox build and configuration setup. More info: Build Config module description.

Private Browsing.description: For bugs and feature requests in Firefox's Private Browsing implementation.

Developer Tools: Netmonitor.description: The Netmonitor is the network logging feature in the Firefox Developer Tools.

Untriaged.description: For newly filed bugs that need some help finding the right place to go.

Microsummaries.description: Bugs and feature requests for Firefox microsummaries. This includes front-end elements like integration with the bookmarks properties dialog and the bookmarks toolbar as well as back-end elements like automatic updates.

Bookmarks & History.description: Bugs and feature requests for Firefox bookmarks & history. This includes the bookmarks menu, add and modify bookmarks dialogs and the bookmarks manager.

Webapp Runtime.description: The webapp runtime for Firefox, which comprises: the stub executable launcher (i.e. the binary and related files that Firefox creates for each webapp you install to your local computer) and the XUL shell (i.e. the XULRunner application that the launcher uses to load a webapp and provide it with native integration APIs). Note: bugs about Gecko's navigator.mozApps DOM API (i.e. the API that web pages use to request webapp installation) go in Core / DOM: Apps; bugs about Firefox's webapp installer (i.e. the feature that creates a launcher when the user approves an installation request) go in Firefox / Web Apps.

Developer Tools: Inspector.description: For issues with the Highlighter, Rule Inspector, Style Inspector and HTML view within Firefox developer tools

Search.description: Internet search from the Toolbar Search field

SocialAPI: Providers.description: This component is used to track bugs in code from third-party social providers that use the Social API. For bugs in Firefox's implementation of the Social API, use Firefox::SocialAPI.

RSS Discovery and Preview.description: Bugs in Firefox's discovery of RSS feeds and inline preview. This is separate from live bookmarks.

Shell Integration.description: Areas where Firefox integrates with the host desktop environment. Please use the "Theme" component for any Theme-related issues. Please use the "Core" product for other OS integration problems.

Preferences.description:
Bugs and feature requests for Firefox preferences. This includes the Tools->Options UI as well as the preference
defaults.

Installer.description: Bugs and feature requests for the Firefox application install wizard.

Migration.description: Firefox Profile Migration from other browsers.

Developer Tools: Framework.description: Bugs pertaining to the Developer Tools Toolbox and remote connection mechanisms.

Menus.description: Bugs and feature requests for Firefox menus. This includes toplevel and context menus.

Developer Tools: Debugger.description: For issues relating to the debugging features in Firefox developer tools

Developer Tools: Scratchpad.description: For issues with the JavaScript Scratchpad feature of Firefox developer tools

Developer Tools: Console.description: For issues with the Web Console, Graphical Command Line (GCLI), console object, etc within Firefox developer tools

WinQual Reports.description: Bugs filed against WinQual crash/hang data

NSPR.description: The Netscape Portable Runtime - Mozilla's cross-platform portability layer (more info)
Cross-platform library providing runtime services, including threading, synchronization, File and Network I/O services, with a platform-independent API.

Minimo.description: Browser for limited resource devices (more info)

General.description: For general Minimo bugs. If it doesn't fit into one of the other Minimo components, then file it here.

Device Specific.description:
For Minimo bugs that can only be reproduced on a specific device
or set of devices

Build Config.description: For Minimo build and configuration issues.

Minimo Front-End.description: For bugs in the Minimo UI/front-end.

addons.mozilla.org.description: The website hosting add-ons for Mozilla products (addons.mozilla.org).

Plugins.description: For problems with or changes to Plugin listings, the Plugin Finder Service, or anything relating to Plugins on addons.mozilla.org. Plugins are third-party binaries like Flash, Quicktime, Java, etc.

Dictionaries.description:
Regarding dictionaries hosted on addons.mozilla.org and the
dictionaries page

Facebook Application.description: Bugs and enhancement requests for Rock Your Firefox, the addons.mozilla.org Facebook application

Administration.description: For changing access rights, managing accounts and other site administrative issues that don't fit elsewhere.

Add-on Validation.description: Bugs and feature requests concerning add-on validation.

Search.description: For issues related to the AMO search engine including relevancy.

Public Pages.description: For problems with the user-facing portion of addons.mozilla.org (not the Developers area).

Search Plugins.description: Problems or changes for Search Plugins hosted on addons.mozilla.org, or their public-facing web pages. Search Plugins are .scr files that let users add customer search engines to their search bar (upper right).

Compatibility Tools.description: For bugs and features of add-on compatibility tools, like the Add-on Compatibility Reporter extension, Compatibility Report Viewer, and Compatibility Dashboard. Bugs for specific add-ons should go in Firefox :: Extension Compatibility.

Code Quality.description:
Coding standards and organization, minor notices/warnings/errors,
refactoring.

Statistics.description:
Problems and enhancements concerning the developers' Statistics
Dashboard or related scripts.

Add-on Security.description: For reporting security bugs found in add-ons.

Maintenance Scripts.description: For problems or changes to regularly scheduled maintenance scripts that update and clean addons.mozilla.org data.

Localization.description:
addons.mozilla.org localization tracking and Localizer Control
Panel issues

Discovery Pane.description: Issues with the content of the Discovery Pane or "Get Add-ons" pane of the tab-based Firefox Add-ons Manager

Policy.description: Problems or questions about addons.mozilla.org policies. Also for reporting obvious violations of Mozilla or addons.mozilla.org policies related to an add-on or group of add-ons.

Add-on Builder.description:
Bugs and feature requests for the builder.addons.mozilla.org
site.

Blocklisting.description: Requests to blocklist an add-on, plugin, or other third party component. Please read our policies first.

Admin/Editor Tools.description: Tools and pages for administrators and editors.

Developer Pages.description: For issues with the Developer Hub or Developer Tools areas of addons.mozilla.org

Android Background Services.description: Native Android services, including those bundled with Fennec. (More info)

Firefox Health Report Service.description: The Android-native component for managing Firefox Health Report submissions.

Homepage Promos.description: Android client code for the homepage snippet promos feature in Firefox for Android.

Build & Test.description: Jenkins, testing, Git, and build infrastructure for Android Sync.

Android Sync.description: For all bugs in the Android/Native Fennec version of Firefox Sync.

Product Announcements.description: Android client code for the Product Announcements feature in Firefox for Android.

Marketplace.description: Mozilla's website (marketplace.firefox.com) to bring personalized discovery, worldwide distribution, and easy payments to the largest platform for app development: the Web. (more info)

Statistics.description: Problems and enhancements concerning the developers' Statistics Dashboard or related scripts.

Admin Tools.description: Problems and enhancements concerning tools and pages for app administration.

Security.description: Problems and enhancements concerning Marketplace security.

General.description: If you are not clear where to file your bug/request, file here.

Reviewer Tools.description: Problems and enhancements concerning tools and pages for app reviewers.

API.description: Issues and feature requests related to Marketplace APIs.

Validation.description: Bugs and feature requests concerning app validation.

Search.description: Problems and enhancements concerning Marketplace search.

Consumer Pages.description: For problems with the user-facing portion of marketplace.mozilla.org. This includes Homepage, Apps details page, Account settings etc

Reference Apps.description: Bugs relating to apps Mozilla maintains but does not ship with Gaia. These are apps on the Marketplace that also serve as a best practice reference for Open Web Apps.

Code Quality.description: Coding standards and organization, minor notices/warnings/errors, refactoring

Developer Pages.description: For issues with the Developer pages (Submission, Management and Documentation) of Apps.

Integration.description: This component is for all tracking bugs for integration of Marketplace with Gaia, Identity and other products.

Payments/Refunds.description: Problems and enhancements concerning App purchase and refunds.

Input.description: Input is the feedback tool for Firefox.

General.description: For bugs not related to any specific component.

Code Quality.description: Tasks related to code quality and general betterness.

Webtools.description: For bugs in the tools that mozilla.org uses. This includes web-based tools like MXR, Bonsai, and Tinderbox but not Bugzilla. It also includes bugs in tools such as mozbot.

Doctor.description: Doctor is a tool for editing documents on the mozilla.org website without using CVS.

ISPDB Database Entries.description: Additions and Edits for the entries in the ISP web configuration database, used for Thunderbird's account autoconfiguration.

Bouncer.description: a download requests redirector that tracks mirror availability and capacity and directs downloaders to available mirrors

Toolbox.description: An index of Mozilla software tools.

Hendrix.description: The public feedback tool deployed at hendrix.mozilla.org

Mozbot.description: IRC robot that watches tinderbox and other things

Telemetry Dashboard.description: A web frontend for Telemetry data

General.description: Requests for the Webtools team that don't fit elsewhere

SSO.description: Single sign-on service for Mozilla websites.

ISPDB Server.description: The ISP web configuration server software for Thunderbird's account autoconfiguration. This component is not for issues relating to the database entries.

Tinderboxpushlog.description: For issues with TinderboxPushlog (TBPL), a web app that correlates checkins with their test results. https://tbpl.mozilla.org / https://hg.mozilla.org/webtools/tbpl

Dragnet.description: Bugs related to the DLL Directory

Litmus.description: Litmus is a Testcase Management System. It is a way to document testcases, and track the outcome of running documented testcases.

Bonsai.description: Web based Tree control system for watching the up-to-the-minute goings-on in a CVS repository

Air Mozilla.description: Bugs and feature requests for the Air Mozilla webapp, only.

Cesium.description: Tool for automating and graphing ySlow tests.

Web Sniffer.description: Web Sniffer is a set of tools to work with the protocols underlying the Web. Its main purpose is to let you see the HTTP headers returned by a web server

Tinderbox3.description: This is another rewrite of Tinderbox.

Witness.description: This is for the Witness document-signing project (more info).

mediawiki-bugzilla.description: Issues associated with the Mediawiki-Bugzilla plugin and Mozilla's implementation.

TCM.description: TCM is a Testcase Manager built to run, create/edit testcases, and track the results of running created/edited testcases.

kanbanzilla.description: A kanban board on top of Bugzilla for triaging bugs.

Leeroy.description: Speculative integration testing service for Jenkins and Github

Sheriff.description: For issues with the Sheriff web app. The Sheriff app is used to track the sheriffing schedule for mozilla-central, and is available at http://sheriff.mozilla.org/.

Elmo.description: Elmo is the codename for the new version of the Mozilla localization portal. It is an infrastructure of web apps, tools and documentation intended to help the l10n community and developers alike.

Webtest.description: A web tool to load test web applications over time.

BzAPI.description: A proxy implementing a RESTful HTTP API for Bugzilla (more info)

Verbatim.description: Bugs regarding new l10n web tool.

Pontoon.description: File bugs against any aspect of the Pontoon l10n system. Including Web Client, Server, Jetpack, etc.

Prior Art.description: Open user-generated catalog of software patent prior art.

Tinderbox.description: Tree-watching system to monitor continuous builds that we run on multiple platforms.

Tree Status.description: The web app used to maintain the open/closed state of gecko-related development trees.

Tinderbox2.description: This is a rewrite of Tinderbox.

DXR.description: A web-based source code indexing and cross-reference tool that uses semantic data from static analysis tools.

Headrush.description: Idea tool used to track new ideas.

Graph Server.description: Performance data collection and graphing server.

PTO.description: Mozilla Corporation paid time off application used for tracking vacation.

Reporter.description: Service that accepts, monitors and allows users to search for problems generated by the Reporter XUL extension.

Domesday.description: Domesday is the name of the software which will run a Mozilla Contributor Directory. (more info)

Mozilla Community Sites.description:
A tool for Mozilla communities to set up a local web
site with a main page, blog, planet, forum, and wiki. The install comes with a style guide and is customizable by the local community.

Boot2Gecko.description: FirefoxOS, or Boot2Gecko (B2G) is Mozilla's operating system built on web standards. (more info)

Builds.description: For problems or requests regarding device or desktop build packaging or automation.

Gaia::Keyboard.description: Any issues related to Gaia's keyboard.

Gaia::Homescreen.description: Bugs related to Gaia's Homescreen app that should focus on issues involving the different grids of icons.

Gaia::Settings.description: Bugs related to Gaia's Settings app.

Gaia::System::Lockscreen.description: Any issues related to Gaia's lockscreen.

Gaia::System.description: Bugs related to any piece of Gaia's system app, which includes - window management, wrapper logic for everything.me, notifications, dialogs, etc.

Hardware.description: As part of the B2G Test Drivers (dogfooding) program, we are requiring people to submit bugs here to request hardware (phones).

General.description: For bugs in Boot2Gecko / B2G / Firefox OS that are not more specifically Gecko or Gaia (user interface) bugs.

Gaia::E-Mail.description: Gaia E-mail Application. New bugs should include the information requested at wiki.mozilla.org/Gaia/Email/RequiredBugInfo.

Gaia::Bluetooth File Transfer.description: Any issues related to bluetooth in Gaia directly related to the system itself.

Vendcom.description: The vendor requests to generate the authority for the listed accounts due to everyone of them needs to modify issues, not only monitor.

Gaia::Calendar.description: Gaia calendar app, protocol issues, features, bugs etc.

Gaia::Everything.me.description: Any issues related to Everything.me integration across the homescreen and system wrapper.

Gaia.description: For bugs related to the Boot2Gecko user interface and apps.

Account Manager.description: Bugs in the Account Manager feature, which negotiates and automates authentication, account creation, and other account-related actions.

Fennec Graveyard.description: Old, retired Fennec bugs. Fennec is the code name of the effort to build a mobile version of Firefox (more info)

Shell Integration.description: Issues related to operating system integration, registration, and launch for mobile firefox.

Panning/Zooming.description: Bugs and feature requests for panning (a.k.a scrolling) and zooming on touch-screen interfaces.

General.description: For bugs in Fennec which do not fit into other more specific Fennec components.

Extension Compatibility.description: Extension related problems including application changes that break extensions and extension issues that break the application.

Theme.description: Bugs and requests for enhancements or changes to the default theme that ships with Firefox Mobile (XUL based UI).

Bookmarks.description: Bugs and feature requests for bookmarks. This includes the add and modify bookmarks dialogs and the bookmarks manager.

SeaMonkey.description: An all-in-one internet application suite, including web browser, e-mail and newsgroup client, and HTML composer. (more info)

Tabbed Browser.description: problems in the browser tab features or problems with the <tabbrowser> widget itself.

MailNews: General.description:
All SeaMonkey-specific MailNews bugs that are not covered by one of the other SeaMonkey MailNews components.
PLEASE NOTE!! Try to find a component which is specific to your bug first - BEFORE assigning to this component!

Passwords & Permissions.description: Only problems with the UI for Password Manager, PopUp/Image blocking, Cookies and Wallet should go into this component. Backend code for most of those is shared, you should use the "Core" product for bugs regarding those backends.

Find In Page.description: This component covers bugs in the "Find As You Type" (also known as "Type Ahead Find" or "Incremental Search") feature, which allows quick web page navigation when you type a sequence of characters in the body of the displayed page (not in the Location Bar, edit boxes, or other form elements). Sample bugs include: not finding text on a page, not highlighting text, crashing, etc.

Release Engineering.description: For bugs related to all aspects of the Build and Release Engineering process of the SeaMonkey project, including Build/Release Automation, nightly build machines, and buildbots.

Location Bar.description: This is the type-in history for the Location bar in the browser window. This includes behavior of the autocomplete widget for URIs, as well as the storage and expiration of the entries. Examples of appropriate bugs: URIs incorrectly added to the drop down list, crashes, hangs, slowness when using this feature.

OS Integration.description: Areas where SeaMonkey integrates with the host desktop environment. Please use the "Themes" component for any Theme-related issues. Please use the "Core" product for other OS integration problems.

Bookmarks & History.description:
Problems with the Bookmarks and History UI, including adding, deleting,
editing. Also includes problems with Bookmarks Manager, toolbar ("Personal
Toolbar") and menu, History window and "Go" menu.

Download & File Handling.description: Problems with download and file handling UI in SeaMonkey. This includes the download manager window, "helper applications" UI, and open/save file dialogs.

Search.description:
For bugs associated with the Search button, the Search Results Sidebar panel, and Advanced Search. For bugs involving the "Find" or "Find on Page..." menu items, use Mozilla Application Suite: XPApps.

Examples of appropriate bugs: Keyword searches should open Sidebar and show results; or Search button does not invoke dialog.

Page Info.description: For issues with the Page Info window.

Session Restore.description: For bugs in the SeaMonkey session restore functionality.

Sidebar.description: The Sidebar is a content area that holds a set of mini-webpages or data such as bookmarks or mail folders, or a web search panel. This component also includes all integrated web search features of SeaMonkey.

Composer.description: For bugs in the Composer application, the high-level application that is used to create HTML documents. Appropriate bugs include those not belonging to the core editor engine, including an inability to launch the composer application and problems in the general user interface of the composer application or toolbar, such as incorrectly behaving toolbar buttons and menu items, and incorrect dialog behavior. Please see the bug description for Editor: Core for more information.

Security.description:
For app-level security bugs.

If the problem relates to underlying components (PSM, NSS, Core) then please file it in the appropriate product instead of here.

Preferences.description: Preference Panels; default preferences; etc. For bugs that affect the Preferences window's user interface generally like "no scrollbar in category pane" use this component. Do not use this component for bugs in the content of specific preferences panes like "typo in Navigator pref pane" or "radio buttons on Composer pref pane appear uninitialized". Instead, file these sorts of bugs directly to the relevant component: use "Composer" in the last example.

Testing Infrastructure.description:
Bugs relating to the testing infrastructure that is specific to
the SeaMonkey code.

Installer.description:
For bugs in the native Mozilla installers, before Mozilla itself is running. Note: If the installer completes, but Mozilla (or the Mozilla User Profile Manager) won't launch or work correctly, this is not the right place to submit your bug; please try General.

Examples of appropriate bugs: Install Wizard does not allow me to select installation directory; Crash during Installation; Error message on install completion or cancel; Installer script in mail.xpi is defective.

Feed Discovery and Preview.description: For bugs in SeaMonkey's discovery of feeds and inline preview.

General.description:
A "catch all" component for problems found when using the SeaMonkey suite which do not fall into one of the current components. Example: launch/exit crashes, features missing, etc.
PLEASE NOTE!! Try to find a component which is specific to your bug first - BEFORE assigning to this component!

Startup & Profiles.description: Problems using the Profile Manager user interface, profile access code or other problems happening during suite startup (before normal application windows is shown).

MailNews: Message Display.description: Problems with displaying of messages, including main mail window, standalone message window, sidebar contents, toolbars, dialogs, new mail notification, message search, news subscription window, drag'n'drop, etc. A few examples: 1. User interface and functionality problems within the 3-pane mail window and the standalone message window.

Project Organization.description: This covers reports in the areas of Project and Release Mangement, Community/User Relations, Marketing/Press/PR and web pages within the SeaMonkey project. If you're not sure if what you want to report is specifically about the SeaMonkey project, you should probably consider to use the "mozilla.org" or "website" products for reporting your problem.

UI Design.description: Achieving consistency throughout the product both internally and externally. Make sure it doesn't fit into another, more applicable component before you file it here.

MailNews: Backend.description:
SeaMonkey UI and connectivity to mail/news backends not caught by other components. This includes transmission (receiving, sending, receipts), offline, (junk) filters, storage bugs, etc.
Problems with the backend itself should NOT go into that component, but in the mail/news backend components of the "Core" product!

MailNews: Composition.description: Issues with the SeaMonkey mail/news compose window should go in here.

Themes.description: Issues with SeaMonkey's built in themes, including Classic and Modern.

MailNews: Account Configuration.description: Account Manager/Wizard, Preferences panels, etc. Problems with setting up mail and news accounts in SeaMonkey Mail & Newsgroups or with its preference panels. A few examples: 1. User interface and functionality problems with the Account Manager and/or Account Wizard. 2. Managing multiple accounts such as deleting different accounts or adding them. 3. Wrong wording in mail preference panel.

Build Config.description:
For bugs that result from SeaMonkey build problems. ("Building" is the process of converting the thousands of Mozilla source code files into a actual executable software.) If a file in a newly-downloaded build is missing or corrupted, file the bug in this component.

Examples of appropriate bugs: Build date in browser window is incorrect; DLL files are missing from the ZIP file; or Build contains a zero K executable.

Autocomplete.description: Problems with autocompletion (e.g. behavior of the autocomplete widget) anywhere in the application. This includes autocomplete in the URLbar and mailnews address fields.

Sync UI.description:
For bugs in the SeaMonkey Sync UI functionality, including Sync
setup, preferences, notifications, toolbar button and menu entries as well as Tabs From Other Computers.

Help.description: Use this component to report problems with the Help menu, Help menu items, Help Viewer and SeaMonkey Help content. Examples: Clicking a Help menu item fails to open the appropriate Help file or Help Viewer has missing buttons.

MailNews: Address Book & Contacts.description:
Problems with using the Address Book such as creating new cards, manipulating the data from the Address Book. Problems with VCard support and Address Book sidebar should also be reported in this component. A few examples: 1. User interface and functionality problems with the Address Book. 2. Trying to use the import tool such as importing or exporting address book cards.
Most of the Address Book is shared code and bugs not specific to SeaMonkey should be filed in the 'Core' product instead!

Mozilla Labs Graveyard.description: Old, retired Mozilla Labs projects. Some products may have graduated to other places.

FlightDeck.description:
Bugs and feature requests for the FlightDeck project from Mozilla Labs.

FlightDeck was replaced by addons.mozilla.org::Add-on Builder

Mozilla Labs.description: For bugs and requests related to management of Mozilla Labs and related projects.

Chocolate Factory.description: Bugs and feature requests for the Chocolate Factory experiment from Mozilla Labs.

Ubiquity.description: Bugs and feature requests for the Ubiquity experiment from Mozilla Labs.

Research.description: For tasks related to Mozilla Research.

JS Modules.description:
Bugs and feature requests for JavaScript modules that various labs
projects use to make add-on development easier.

Test Pilot Studies.description: Bugs for particular studies within the Test Pilot program.

Personas.description: Bugs and feature requests for the Personas experiment from Mozilla Labs

Test Pilot Data Requests.description: Bugs in this component are used to track requests for data from the Test Pilot team. This includes either new data that needs to be gathered, or new analysis of already-collected data.

Jetpack SDK.description:
Warning! This Bugzilla component is obsolete. Please file bugs in the Add-on SDK product instead:

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/enter_bug.cgi?product=Add-on%20SDK

Gaming.description: For design, development, and other tasks related to the Mozilla Gaming project and Game On competition.

Operator.description: Bugs and feature requests for the Operator experiment from Mozilla Labs.

Identity.description: Bugs and feature requests for the identity-related experiments from Mozilla Labs.

Design.description: Request for graphic design work within the broader Mozilla Labs context.

OpenWebApps.description: Bugs, review and feature requests for the open web applications project.

Joey.description: Bugs and feature requests for the Joey experiment from Mozilla Labs.

Labs Pack.description: Bugs and feature requests for Protofox/Sigma/Labs Pack Labs channel add-on

General.description: For operational issues and one-off experiments that we don't need a dedicated component for.

Concept Series.description: Bugs and feature requests for the Concept Series experiment from Mozilla Labs.

New Tab.description: Bugs and feature requests for the New Tab prototype.

Test Pilot.description: Bugs and feature requests for the Test Pilot experiment from Mozilla Labs.

Snowl.description: Bugs and feature requests for the Snowl experiment from Mozilla Labs.

Prism.description: Bugs and feature requests for the Prism experiment from Mozilla Labs.

Raindrop.description: Bugs and feature requests for the Raindrop messaging experiment from Mozilla Labs.

F1.description:
Firefox add-on and web service to make sharing links to
webpages with others easy.

Contacts.description: Mozilla Labs' experimental 'Contacts' add-ons for Thunderbird and Firefox

Doctor JS.description: Doctor JS is a free online web service for statically analyzing JavaScript source. It performs a type-based control flow analysis to infer types for all definitions in a program. http://doctorjs.org

Jetpack Prototype.description:
Bugs and feature requests for the Jetpack prototype from
Mozilla Labs.

Tracking.description: For tracking bugs that cross multiple products and services

User Story.description: This component is used by product, program and development managers on the Apps Ecosystem team to track user stories against development tasks.

Metro Operations.description: Use this component for all user stories/epics/iterations in our V1 product development.

Kilimanjaro.description: Tracking bugs for the Kilimanjaro project - https://wiki.mozilla.org/Kilimanjaro

CCK.description: The Client Customization Kit, for corporate/organization rollouts (more info)

CCK-Installation.description: The CCK installation includes verifying the CD-layout. Other areas include the installations screens, directory structure, branding and launching the CCK Wizard.

CCK-General.description: CCK bugs which do not fit into one of the other CCK components.

CCK-Wizard.description: The CCK wizard allows the user to gather data by walking through a series of screens to create a set of customizations and build a media image.

Reports/Deliverables.description:
For issues relating to reporting, documentation, and
delivery of products as part of grant agreements with funders.

Applications.description:
Submissions for grant funding support from external
organizations.

Administration/Accounting.description:
For issues relating to the management, reporting,
and accounting of grants.

Derivatives.description: Sometimes bugs are reported to Bugzilla which are really bugs in a product that is derived from Mozilla and should be reported elsewhere. When you find such bugs assign them to this product to nominate them for transfer to the proper bug database. You cannot file bugs in this component. Examples: AIM or Net2Phone bugs in Netscape 6.

Netscape 6.description: This component is for bugs found in items that are unique to Netscape 6. Sometimes bugs are reported to Bugzilla which are really bugs in Netscape 6. When you find such bugs assign them to this component to nominate them for transfer to Netscape's bug database. Do not file new bugs to this component. For instance AIM or Net2Phone bugs.

Petri.description: Petri is a Mozilla PaaS/IaaS experimental project.

General.description: For bugs in Petri which do not fit into other more specific Petri components

Pancake.description: Pancake is a Mozilla Labs project using search and navigation history.

Front-end.description: Code that runs in the front-end on the client.

Dashboard.description: The web app for metrics, statistics, server status, etc.

General.description: Anything that doesn't fit in the other components, or spans multiple components.

Back-end.description: Code that runs on the back-end to support the front-end.

Add-On.description: The add-on that keeps your data in sync with Pancake

Sync.description: Code related to the sync client.

Mozilla Metrics.description: Internal Mozilla Corp. database to house statistical/market data

Metrics Operations.description: Issues related to the administration and operations of Metrics infrastructure

Hadoop/HBase Operations.description: For problems related to the Hadoop/HBase clusters maintained by Metrics. e.g. the Socorro project by providing storage and processing of crash reports.

downloadstats.mozilla.com.description: Website dedicated to the displaying of download statistics for Firefox.

Frontend Reports.description: For problems related to metrics.mozilla.com dashboards, e-mail reports, new metrics project requests

Metrics Data Ping.description: Metrics bugs related to the Toolkit feature and backend data collection web service to enable the collection of anonymous, aggregate metrics regarding usage, performance, and health in an opt-out manner

Data/Backend Reports.description: For problems related to ETL, data processing, data warehouse storage, or data exports

General.description: Design, specification and all other bugs and requests that don't fit in other components.

JS Library.description: JavaScript implementation of L20n, i.e. l20n.js

HTML Bindings.description: Bindings to HTML which allow for client-side localization of DOM

General.description: General

Community Tools.description: Suite of tools that helps make it easier for people to get involved in the Mozilla Project.

Safari Books Online.description: Safari Books Online is an electronic reference library for programmers and IT professionals.

Rosetta Stone.description: Rosetta Stone is a language learning software that uses Dynamic Immersion methods, online social games and activities, and private sessions to help learners gain language mastery.

API Requests.description: File bugs here to request access to the Phonebook API (more info).

Phonebook.description: Community directory app for all Mozilla project-related contributors, groups, and events (mozillians.org).

Account Help.description: Issues to get help with account changes or access.

TaskBoard.description: A task discovery app for all Mozilla projects and teams to garner greater contributions from volunteers.

Events Manager.description: A events discovery app for all Mozilla projects and teams to garner greater even participation from volunteers.

Mozilla Localizations.description: Translation, spelling and other errors in language packs and localized builds (more info)

bs / Bosnian.description:
Bosnian translation of Mozilla / Prevod Mozille na 
bosanski

it / Italian.description: Italian translation of Mozilla. (Traduzione italiana di Mozilla)

nn-NO / Norwegian Nynorsk.description: Norwegian (nynorsk) translation of Mozilla. (Norsk (nynorsk) omsetjing av Mozilla)

nl / Dutch.description: Dutch translation of Mozilla. (Nederlandse vertaling van Mozilla)

sv-SE / Swedish.description: Swedish translation of Mozilla. (Svensk versttning av Mozilla)

MozillaTranslator.description: MozillaTranslator is a Java based GUI tool, for helping with localizing Mozilla and Phoenix.

id / Indonesian.description: Indonesian Localization (Alih bahasa dalam Bahasa Indonesia)

fr / French.description: French translation of Mozilla. (Traduction de Mozilla en franais)

Registration & Management.description:
Use this component to register a new l10n contributer group with the MLP-Staff.

Please provide: your name(s), your contact address(es), eventually a web site where you can coordinate and make available your work and a languagecode-NATIONCODE.

da / Danish.description: Danish translation of Mozilla. (Dansk oversttelse af Mozilla)

Infrastructure.description: Infrastructure for Mozilla Localizations. An example of appropriate bug would be feature requests to understand the status of localizations, both from a localizer and organizational perspective. Bugs in this component likely depend on actual implementations in other components, for example build or webdev.

eu / Basque.description: Basque translation of Mozilla - Euskarazko lokalizazioa.

pt-BR / Portuguese (Brazil).description: Brazilian Portuguese translation of Mozilla (Traduo do Mozilla para Portugus do Brasil)

Documentation.description: Bugs to help track and manage issues in the l10n team's wiki docs.

es-ES / Spanish.description: Spanish translation of Mozilla. (Informar sobre fallos en la traducción de mozilla en español)

nb-NO / Norwegian Bokml.description: Norwegian (bokml) translation of Mozilla. (Norsk (bokml) oversettelse av Mozilla)

www.mozilla.org.description: For issues with content on www.mozilla.org http servers (but not the functioning of the servers) (more info)

Thunderbird.description: For issues with content on www.mozilla.org/thunderbird http servers (but not the functioning of the servers).

Newsletters.description: Bugs and feature requests related to the Newsletter subscription service of Mozilla.org

Information Architecture & UX.description: Work related to usability, accessibility, interaction design and organizing site information.

General.description: Miscellaneous requests that do not fit in any other component.

Bedrock.description: Bugs and feature requests related to the mozilla.org back end platform.

Analytics.description: Bugs and feature requests related to tracking & traffic information.

L10N.description: For localizing pages, content and media on www.mozilla.org.

Legacy PHP system.description: Bugs and feature requests related to the legacy codebase.

Pages & Content.description: For creating and updating pages and anything related to HTML/CSS/JS.

Snippets.description: The about:home snippet service is a simple, highly-cached content management service. It is intended to assemble and deliver content snippets to the about:home page in Firefox. The content delivered is determined by details about the installation of Firefox requesting content - including mainly details about the browser's build, locale, platform, and distribution channel, but not the person using the browser.

Surveys.description: Snippets that involve questions being presented to the about:home visitors.

General.description: Bugs not related to any specific component.

Service.description: The content management system and services that are used to present content to the about:home visitors.

Campaign.description: Engagement campaigns to go live in the snippet channel. Include the following information: Copy, Tagged Link, Link to the PNG graphic URL, Live Date, End Date, Firefox Version, Locale/s.

Firefox for Android.description: Firefox for Android is a mobile version of Firefox for Android devices. (more info)

Data Providers.description: The databases and content providers that handle storage and import/export of profile data, including bookmarks, history, passwords, and form history. (Note: Bugs in Firefox Sync should be filed in the "Mozilla Services" product instead.)

Keyboards and IME.description: For bugs related to Android text input, such as HTML forms, the Awesome Screen, third-party software keyboards, and hardware keyboards.

Download Manager.description: The user interface for displaying download notifications and progress, and managing downloaded files.

Plugins.description: Support for content that uses the Adobe Flash Player plug-in for Android.

General.description: For bugs in Fennec which do not fit into other more specific Fennec components.

Reader Mode.description: The mobile Firefox interface for saving pages to the user's Reading List and displaying them in a special reading mode.

Readability.description: Text and font rendering, font inflation, and facilities for adjusting readability of text.

Graphics, Panning and Zooming.description: Android-specific code for fast painting, scrolling, and scaling of pages on the screen.

JimDB.description: Scripts and utilities for gdb to aid debugging Firefox on Android

Web Apps.description: Installing, running, and managing open web applications from the Mozilla Marketplace or other sources.

Theme and Visual Design.description: Changes to the images, colors, and general look and feel of the Firefox user interface on Android.

Add-on Manager.description: Installing and uninstalling extensions, search plugins, and other add-ons. Listing and managing add-ons and their settings.

Text Selection.description: Touch gestures and draggable handles for selecting and copying text in web pages and forms, and for changing the cursor or selection position.

Awesomescreen.description: The Awesomescreen is the user interface for displaying and managing top sites, bookmarks, history, and search suggestions in mobile Firefox, and for entering and editing URLs and searches.

Socorro.description: For issues with the Socorro server which accepts and processes Breakpad crash reports.

Infra.description: Requests for Skiplist changes, deployment issues, and other configuration changes, including build infrastructure and automation

Middleware.description: Issues relating to the internal Socorro API

Database.description: Issues and requests to do with the PostgreSQL database

Data request.description: Requests for ad hoc reporting, queries against HBase, queries against PostgreSQL, etc

General.description: Any issues that don't fit elsewhere; tracker bugs for new features that affect many components

Backend.description: Issues and requests to do with collection, processing, cron jobs, and other back end components

Webapp.description: Issues and requests relating to the web app visible at crash-stats.mozilla.com

Mozmill Crowd Extension.description: Bugs or feature requests for the Mozmill crowd extension.

Mozmill Result Dashboard.description: Bugs or feature requests for the results dashboard of Mozmill tests.

Testopia.description: Testopia is a test case management system that sits on top of Bugzilla.

General.description: General

quality.mozilla.org.description: For issues relating to the quality.mozilla.org website, also known as QMO.

Website.description: For issues related to the QMO website.

Content.description: For issues related to adding or removing content from QMO.

Extend Firefox.description: For issues related to the Extend Firefox contest, web site, etc.

General.description: Issues not related to the Web Site for the Extend Firefox competitions.

Web Site.description: Issues relating to the main web site for the Extend Firefox competitions.

ICAL.js Integration.description:
Bugs within the integration layer for the ICAL.js library from <https://github.com/mozilla-comm/ical.js>.

For issues with the library itself (i.e in calendar/base/modules/ical.js), please file an issue on github. This component is about the wrapper interface between xpcom and ICAL.js

Sunbird Only.description: For issues that only affect the Sunbird product. For example: toolbars, menu items, sunbird specific preferences, etc. Note that localization issues should be reported to the Mozilla Localization project.

Provider: ICS/WebDAV.description: For issues regarding communicating with .ics files via remote (http:) and local (file:) URIs.

Lightning: SeaMonkey Integration.description: For issues that only affect the Lightning product on SeaMonkey. For example: SeaMonkey integration, preferences, etc.

Calendar Views.description: For issues concerning the grid views: month, week, multiweek, and day. Issues concerning display, drag/drop, searching, and inline editing of events/tasks

Alarms.description: For issues with alarms for scheduled events and tasks.

Dialogs.description: For issues with the calendar, event, and task dialogs.

OS Integration.description: Areas where Calendar integrates with the host desktop environment. Please use the relevant UI component for any Theme-related issues. Please use the "Core" product for other OS integration problems.

Website.description: For issues with the Calendar Project web pages (HTML). (Bugs in the on-line help documentation should be reported at the calendarhelp project.)

Provider: CalDAV.description: For issues with CalDAV server communication

Tasks.description: For issues with Task lists, display, editing, and searching. (If it applies only to tasks file it here, if it applies to tasks and events file it in the view component).

Import and Export.description: For issues with format conversions (for importing, exporting, emailing, cutting, pasting, dragging, and dropping to/from another application).

Provider: GData.description: For issues regarding the 'Provider for Google Calendar' extension

Security.description:
For app-level security bugs.

If the problem relates to underlying components (PSM, NSS, Core, Toolkit) then please file it in the appropriate product instead of here.

E-mail based Scheduling (iTIP/iMIP).description: For issues with E-mail based scheduling, e.g. accepting invitations or sending out invitations, replies etc.

General.description: For issues which don't fit in a more specific Calendar component.

Lightning Only.description: For issues that only affect the Lightning product. For example: Lightning menus, toolbars, Thunderbird integration, preferences etc. Note that localization issues should be reported to the Mozilla Localization project.

Provider: Local Storage.description: For issues regarding local calendar storage, based on mozStorage (SQLite).

Internal Components.description: For issues with the internal interfaces of the calendar components. Bug example: Incorrect timezone calculations.

Grendel.description: The Grendel Java-based mail/news reader (more info)

Preferences.description: Problems with the preferences back-end code. This includes preferences not being saved, issues retrieving preferences, problems applying user settings, and other back-end issues. User interface issues should be filed in Grendel: User Interface.

Addressbook/LDAP (non-UI).description: Issues with the Grendel Address Book that does NOT include user interface issues. Those should go under Grendel: User Interface.

Protocols.description: Grendel protocol issues (like problems using SMTP, NTTP, POP3, or other protocols Grendel supports) should be filed here. Problems include issues downloading from a certain protocol or protocol specific issues.

User Interface.description: Any issues with the Grendel user-interface. This includes issues displaying the main Grendel window, Address Book window, or dialogs.

mozillaignite.description: Mozilla Ignite is joint project with the National Science Foundation (NSF) to help people make apps that improve people's lives.

General.description: For general bugs related to the mozillaignite product.

JSS.description: Network Security Services for Java - a Java interface to NSS (more info)

Web Apps.description: Web Apps are applications that run on any device, and can be distributed through any store or directly by the developer.

HTML.description: Any issues with the html / javascript implementation of the web apps platform

Soup.description: Android Application to access, and install applications from the marketplace

Infrastructure.description: Infrastructure requirements to support the WebApps effort.

Extension.description: Firefox Extension to access, and install applications from the marketplace

Dashboard.description: Dashboard is where you view and launch your currently installed apps.

General.description: Any other issues not covered.

AppsInTheCloud.description: Service that syncs your apps between your android / mac / windows devices.

Party Tool.description: For bugs related to the Party Tool, which will be used in the planning of Firefox parties.

Download Day.description: Bugs regarding the download day website.

Five Years of Firefox.description: Website bugs for the 5 years of Firefox campaign get filed here.

Core.description: Shared components used by Firefox and other Mozilla software, including handling of Web content; Gecko, HTML, CSS, layout, scripts, images, networking, etc. (More info)

mach.description: For bugs related to the "mach" command-line tool.

History: Global.description: This is the global history which tracks all URLs that a user has visited, across all sessions of the browser. This also includes the history window and link coloring. Examples of appropriate bugs: Chrome URLs incorrectly added to global history, Reproducible crash when sorting by Title in History window, misbehaviour in the History sidebar tab.

Embedding: Mac.description: Covers issues and bugs specific to embedding in Mac Carbon or Cocoa applications.

DOM: IndexedDB.description: This component covers the IndexedDB implementation in Gecko.

RDF.description: Resource Description Framework: Core RDF components, including the in-memory datasource, composite datasource, RDF/XML parser, and RDF resource manager.

Identity.description: Persona / BrowserID Gecko and Firefox integration

Widget.description: Cross platform widget interfaces and cross platform base implementations. Bugs that belong in this component are cross-platform problems and API issues. Bugs like this that only occur on one platform belong in the appropriate component listed below.

WebRTC: Networking.description: Bugs in the networking portions of WebRTC (PeerConnection dataChannels, SCTP, DTLS, SRTP, ICE, TURN, STUN, etc)

DOM: Workers.description: This component covers the Web Workers implementation in Gecko.

js-ctypes.description: js-ctypes is a ffi (Foreign Function Interface) component for JS/XPCOM. js-ctypes allows developers to call functions in dlls/shared libraries directly from JavaScript without the need to create binary XPCOM wrappers.

Plug-ins.description: Bugs in core Mozilla code that supports registering and using plug-ins. For bugs in specific plugins, please file those bugs under Plugins.

Layout: View Rendering.description: Painting problems. If the object is in the right place, but doesn't paint correctly, it's a view system bug. If it paints OK, but in the wrong place, then it belongs in another Layout component. Bugs with the 'opacity', 'z-index', 'overflow', and 'clip' properties usually belong in this component. (In terms of code, this covers the view/ and gfx/src/nsBlender* directories.)

Security.description: For non-crypto security bugs. Or use this general component if you know you have a Browser security bug, but not sure what component to use. Bug will be reviewed for proper component.

Networking: JAR.description:
For bugs relating to the jar protocol handler, .jar file
handling, and .jar directory browsing.

mozglue.description: For issues in the Android glue, the custom dynamic linker or other parts of the mozglue library.

Preferences: Backend.description:
For bugs in libPref, the backend library that reads, parses, and writes preferences to the user's hard disk. Unless you're a Mozilla developer, your bug probably doesn't belong in this component.

Examples of appropriate bugs: prefs.js on the mac has non-mac style line endings; Large libpref string causes dialogs to crash on Linux; or JS Error at startup reading prefs file on migrated profile.

Graphics: Layers.description: The graphics subsystem that implements hardware-accelerated (and software) composition of layers of content.

XPCOM.description: This is the basis of our component technology; this covers the mozilla/xpcom source directory and includes the "repository". Unlikely a tester would be able to tell there was an XPCOM problem specifically.

Profile: Roaming.description: For bugs relating to Profile Roaming support

SVG.description: Bugs against the implementation of the Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) specification. Reads and renders SVG content.

XP Toolkit/Widgets: XUL.description:
For bugs in the XUL language. (XUL is an XML-based language which specifies Mozilla's user interface.)

If you're not actually writing XUL code, this is probably not the right place for your bug.

Examples of appropriate bugs: Duplicate window ID causes infinite loop; or Scrollbars disappear after loading XUL document

Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL).description:
For bugs in the Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL) code regardless of the backend.

Example of appropriate bugs: implementation of a new feature for a backend, fixing a bug for a specific backend or general bugs regarding HAL.

Layout: Tables.description: For bugs in the CSS and HTML table layout and rendering code. For example bugs with the HTML 'rules' attribute or the CSS 'border-collapse' property belong here.

DMD.description: Issues relating to DMD (dark matter detector), the tool for verifying memory reporters.

Layout: Form Controls.description: For problems with HTML Form Elements: buttons, images, edit fields, passwords, file controls, submit buttons, selects, and textareas. NOT for file upload dialog problems, those belong in XP Toolkit/Widgets.

Document Navigation.description: Docshell acts as the glue that initiates and monitors document loading and associates documents to their view for rendering. Previously called Webshell.

Layout.description: For triage, reduction, and reassignment to other layout components.

Networking: HTTP.description:
For bugs in Mozilla's HTTP networking code. This component deals with HTTP specific issues like pipelining, keep-alive, HTTP proxies, 1.1 issues, redirects, authentication (basic), etc.

Examples of appropriate bugs: Problems with proxy authentication; HTTP redirects looping indefinitely, etc.

Installer: XPInstall Engine.description:
For bugs in the underlying cross-platform installation technology. If you encounter an installation failure via a web page, it probably belongs here. Content developers should also report failures of the XPInstall API to this component.

Examples of appropriate bugs: Installer not installing all files; FinalizeInstall() doesn't check or return error codes; or Text from XPInstall confirmation dialog needs revision.

DOM: Apps.description: Bugs related to Gecko's navigator.mozApps DOM API

Networking: WebSockets.description:
For bugs in Mozilla's web sockets implementation, especially protocol and
network-related issues. Issues which are specific to the web sockets DOM
interface may be better classified as Core::DOM.

Networking: Cache.description:
For bugs in the cache, which stores recently accessed data for more rapid access. Includes the disk cache, memory cache, and all cache preferences.

Examples of appropriate bugs: Implement compression of network cache data; or Implement partial HTTP caching.

HTML: Form Submission.description: This component is for bugs with HTML form submission. For example, "hidden controls don't get submitted to the server".

Drag and Drop.description: Description: Problems with drag and drop functionality anywhere in the applications.

XML.description: For bugs in our XML handling. For example, parser errors, or errors in wellformedness error reporting.

Widget: Android.description: Mapping of cross platform widget interfaces to Android platform APIs.

Networking: Cookies.description: A general mechanism which server side connections (such as CGI scripts) can use to both store and retrieve information on the client side of the connection. This refers to HTML cookies; little blobs of data we store and share with sites

Layout: Misc Code.description: For code-level bugs in things like the pres shell, etc.

Widget: Cocoa.description: Mapping of cross platform widget interfaces to Mac Cocoa APIs.

WebDAV.description: Web Distributed Authoring and Versioning protocol support. Currently lives in mozilla/extensions/webdav/.

Layout: Text.description: For problems with enumerating and rendering system fonts, glyph substitution, fallbacks when specified font not available and legibility. Bugs with the CSS 'font' properties belong here.

Graphics.description: Mapping of cross platform rendering interfaces to Cairo APIs.

jemalloc.description:
For bugs relating to improving and integrating jemalloc.

Crashes in jemalloc are usually someone else's fault. Please file the bugs based on the caller instead of in this component.

WebRTC: Signaling.description: Bugs in WebRTC call-setup and re-negotiation code, in particular JSEP and SDP handling

Networking.description:
For bugs in Mozilla's modular networking library (aka "Netlib" or "Necko".) The networking library supplies the software interface that Mozilla uses to access physical transports (e.g. the Internet and local drives), perform URL resolutions, and handle a variety of networking protocols.

Examples of appropriate bugs: URLs with backslash not fetched; URLs starting with a single slash turn into http:///; Cannot access authenticated FTP site.

Embedding: GRE Core.description:
Gecko Runtime Environment is the minimum set of files which are
required for running applications written to embed the Gecko browsing engine. It
contains the core xpcom libraries, nspr library, a set of key XPCOM components
and other supporting files.

Tracking.description: This component is used primarily for "tracking" bugs; bugs used to track a group of bugs.

DOM.description: For bugs in DOM support which do not fit into any other DOM Component. This is the right component for issues with <base href=""> and xml:base. (More info)

Permission Manager.description:
For bugs related to the permission manager but not the permission management.

Example of appropriate bugs: permissions in the database are ignored or removing permission doesn't work.
Example of inappropriate bugs: feature F should use permission P or any user interface related bugs.

Widget: WinRT.description: Mapping of cross platform widget interfaces to WinRT platform APIs

Web Services.description:
For problems in using SOAP and WSDL to call Web Services from scripts in Mozilla.

Examples: WSDL crashes if no <message> defined; WSDL Proxy callback doesn't allow access to the SOAP Response; Need better facilities to debug SOAP calls.

XBL.description: The Extensible Binding Language, used to bind new behavior and new content to XUL and HTML elements.

Video/Audio.description: For problems related to the HTML 5 media elements (<video> and <audio>) and the codec implementations for them (Vorbis, Theora, Web Audio, etc).

Networking: File.description: For bugs in Mozilla's File IO code. This component deals with File specific issues like writing to disk, reading local files, etc Related problems with file:// protocol may also be addressed here.

Java to XPCOM Bridge.description: For bugs with the interoperability between XPCOM components and Java objects.

XP Toolkit/Widgets: Menus.description:
For bugs in the cross-platform menu infrastructure, including the display and behavior of pop-up menus, pull-down menus, and context menus. (Pop-up menus that are part of a web page's content should be assigned to HTML Form Controls.)

Examples of appropriate bugs: Command key symbol is missing from Mac menus; or Context menus pop up in wrong location.

String.description: The hierarchy of classes related to managing character sequences.

Serializers.description: Bugs involving conversion to html or plaintext, either during saving or during copy/paste. This component is NOT for general copy/paste bugs, for bugs involving save dialogs or writing to files when saving, or for I18n-related bugs; only for problems with the actual text which is saved.

Embedding: APIs.description: The embedding API is the set of functions that an external application uses to host an instance of the layout engine within itself. The embedded layout engine provides services for rendering web content (HTML, XML, CSS, etc).

Widget: Gtk.description: Mapping of cross platform widget interfaces to GTK platform APIs (both versions).

ImageLib.description:
ImageLib decodes GIF, JPEG and PNG images, and provides the decoded data to the Compositor for display. If Firefox or Seamonkey can display an image when loaded separately from the page, ImageLib is working, and the actual imaging bug exists elsewhere within Firefox or Seamonkey.

Examples of appropriate bugs: PNG gAMA chunk ignored; Crashes on GIF w/corrupted frame(merr-01.gif); or PNGs and JPEGs aren't displayed on FreeBSD.

File Handling.description: For issues dealing with helper applications, and guessing Content Types when they aren't specified/known (ftp:, file:, jar:, but generally not http:). This component does not cover: backend networking issues, such as those covered by Networking: FTP or Networking: File, nor does it cover the Download Manager which has its own component in Toolkit.

Print Preview.description: Problems in the rendering of Print Preview that are not seen when printing the same page.

Embedding: Packaging.description: This module is comprised of the makefiles and scripts in embedding/config which are used to build the dist/Embed package. Several embedding applications are built from the contents of dist/Embed as well as the packaged version of MfcEmbed.

IPC.description: Inter-process communication mechanism used to isolate plugins and content in separate processes, also known as the Electrolysis project. See https://wiki.mozilla.org/Content_Processes for more details.

Layout: Block and Inline.description: Core layout and geometry for basic block and line elements. For example, margin collapsing bugs, border rendering bugs, and bugs with the inline box model belong here.

Printing: Setup.description: Integration relating to the OS printing system, including cross-platform components such as the page setup dialog.

XUL.description:
XPToolkit includes a User Interface (UI) widget set consisting of menu bars and menus, toolbars and toolboxes, titled buttons, trees, tab widgets, scrollbars, splitters, progress meters, and boxes. Use this category for file picker, color picker, font picker and dialog/window bugs, too. XP Toolkit also accepts bugs relating to copy/paste, drag & drop, key bindings, the clipboard, and focus issues. All bugs concerning skins should use the "Skinability" component.

User interface widgets that are part of a web browser's content (such as web forms) are actually handled by a separate toolbox --- rather than XP Toolkit --- and should be assigned to HTML Form Controls.

Examples of appropriate bugs: Scroll bar disappears when you shrink window; Mouse wheel scrolling broken under Linux; or Horizontal scroll bar flickers mid-screen during window resize.

NOTE: Please use "Keyboard Navigation" component for key cmd problems.

Web Audio.description: Bugs and enhancement requests relating to the Web Audio support.

HTML: Parser.description: This system consumes content from the web, parses, validates and builds a content model (document)

Networking: DNS.description:
For bugs in Mozilla's implementation of DNS (Domain Name
Service)

Widget: Win32.description: Mapping of cross platform widget interfaces to Win32 platform APIs.

Layout: HTML Frames.description: For rendering and layout issues with frames (<iframe>, <frame> and <frameset> elements in HTML).

XForms.description: For bugs with XForms support. This covers all XForms issues including parsing, data model, form controls, and submission.

Layout: Images.description: Bugs related to the layout of images. Use ImageLib for issues with the decoding of images.

Localization.description: Localization is the process of adapting software for a specific international market; this process includes translating the user interface, resizing dialog boxes, replacing icons and other culturally sensitive graphics (if necessary) as well as customizing features.

General.description: For bugs in Core which do not fit into other more specific Core components

JavaScript Engine.description: The interpreter engine for the core JavaScript language, independent of the browser's object model. File ONLY core JavaScript language bugs in this category. For bugs involving browser objects such as "window" and "document", use the "DOM" component. For bugs involving calls between JavaScript and C++, use the "XPConnect" component.

Printing: Output.description: Problems printing from this product should be submitted under this component.

DOM: Core & HTML.description: This component includes all functionality related to JavaScript manipulation of window, document and navigator objects that are available in Navigator 4.x and earlier, and that was never defined by the W3C.

Geolocation.description:
The geolocation API and framework enables reporting a physical
location, in cooperating with a location provider (such as a GPS).

XPConnect.description: Facilitates calling between JavaScript and XPCOM components.

Rewriting and Analysis.description: Features and bugs in the static analysis and rewriting tools used by Mozilla, including Elsa, Oink, and Dehydra.

Editor.description:
For bugs in Mozilla's embeddable editor. If you're encountering a bug with text or rich text editing elsewhere within Gecko-based products, such as within Mail/News, the Location bar, or a dialog box, file it here.

Examples of appropriate bugs: After inserting a image, selecting Undo crashes Composer; After deleting a word, the caret disappears.

DOM: Device Interfaces.description: This component covers WebAPIs exposing device interfaces for communication, networking, multimedia, etc.

Image Blocking.description: For bugs about (un)blocking images from servers.

Embedding: MFC Embed.description: For problems with the mfcEmbed application or the mfcEmbed components

Widget: Gonk.description: Mapping of cross platform widget interfaces to Gonk

Nanojit.description: JIT Compiler Infrastructure shared by Mozilla's TraceMonkey compiler and Adobe's Tamarin compiler.

MFBT.description: File bugs here for headers, macros, data structures, methods, and other functionality which should be available to SpiderMonkey and to all Gecko code, implemented in the mfbt/ source directory.

Event Handling.description: Any strangeness with keyboard typing, mouse actions, focus changes.

Layout: R & A Pos.description: Relative, Absolute, and Fixed positioning, except when printing. If you don't know what this is then please don't move bugs here, instead select "Layout".

Profile: BackEnd.description: Problems with the creation, deletion and changing of user profiles during the installation process.

Widget: Qt.description: Mapping of cross platform widget interfaces to Qt platform APIs.

Spelling checker.description: For bugs with the spelling checker used by Mozilla-based applications. This includes the backend code, the Hunspell spell checker, the en-US Hunspell dictionary, and the osxspell interface to the Mac OS X spell checker.

Selection.description: Selection refers to the user action of selecting all or part of a document and highlighting the selected content.

Canvas: 2D.description: Bugs with the HTML5 <canvas> element, its XUL sibling, and related rendering contexts.

Disability Access APIs.description:
Description: This component relates to bugs in our support for accessibility APIs on the various platforms. Accessibility APIs allow 3rd party products, such as screen readers used by visually impaired users, to communicate with our content and UI. The APIs we support specifically are MSAA on Windows and
ATK on UNIX/Linux (Apple has not yet published specs for an accessibility API on OS X). This component is not for keyboard, focus or any accessibility bugs other than those relating to the APIs we export.

Security: PSM.description: A daemon that performs cryptographic operations on behalf of a client application.

QuickLaunch (AKA turbo mode).description:
For bugs related to the QuickLaunch installer
option and preference, which keeps the application resident in memory after all windows are closed, to speed subsequent component loading.

Internationalization.description: Internationalization is the process of designing and developing a software product to function in multiple locales. This process involves identifying the locales that must be supported, designing features which support those locales, and writing the code needed.

Gecko Profiler.description: The backend to the built-in profiler which can be used in order to get profiling information from within Gecko.

GFX: Color Management.description:
qcms and other issues relating to Mozilla's color management
implementation.

SQL.description: For bugs in Mozilla's SQL support. See the project page for more details.

CSS Parsing and Computation.description:
Bugs in the handling of CSS stylesheets and the computation of style from CSS stylesheets and HTML attributes.

For bugs in the rendering, see the Layout components.

Keyboard: Navigation.description:
Covers keyboard shortcuts, access keys/accelerators, and navigation by using the keyboard (not the mouse or other input device).

Examples: Ctrl+W not closing the browser window under Windows. Command+N not opening a new browser window under Mac OS. Alt+left arrow not going to the previous page under Linux. Alt not accessing the menu or access keys under Windows. Also, the debate as to use Alt or Ctrl under linux as the keyboard accelerator key for shortcuts. Requests for additional keyboard shortcuts.

WebRTC: Audio/Video.description: Bugs in WebRTC audio and video capture, handling, echo cancellation, encoding, and playback

Networking: Domain Lists.description: Requests for changes to the TLD whitelist for IDN (registry representatives only) or the Public Suffix List

Profile: Migration.description: Problems with conversion of profiles from previous versions.

Canvas: WebGL.description: Bugs with the WebGL Canvas Context.

Widget: Photon.description: Mapping of cross platform widget interfaces to Photon platform APIs.

Widget: BeOS.description: Mapping of cross platform widget interfaces to BeOS platform APIs.

Graphics: Text.description: Text and font support in Gecko, including text shaping and font selection.

XSLT.description: For bugs on Mozilla's XSLT support. See the project page for tips on testcases and commonly encountered legacy problems.

Networking: FTP.description:
For bugs in Mozilla's FTP code. This component deals with FTP specific issues like downloading, directory formats, problems with FTP login, or resuming partial downloads, etc.

Examples of appropriate bugs- Problems with multiple occurrences of files in directory listings, corruption in downloading certain files via FTP, etc.

Widget: OS/2.description: Mapping of cross platform widget interfaces to OS/2 platform APIs.

DOM: CSS Object Model.description:
For bugs in our DOM Style support.
