Examples of appropriate bugs: document.styleSheets doesn't hold missing file:// stylesheets; crash setting element.style.color to 'red'.

This is not the place for most style bugs unless they involve scripting. See the Style System and Layout components.

Security: CAPS.description: Caps is the capabilities-based security system for the browser. Manages principals (entities responsible for a piece of code) and the protected capabilities (the ability to perform a restricted action) that may be enabled for given principals.

DOM: Events.description:
For bugs in our DOM Events support. This component deals with event bubbling, event handling, and interfaces such as UIEvent.

Examples of appropriate bugs: cannot cancel 'submit' event; crash when handling a DOMNodeInserted event after inserting a node into anonymous content.

Layout: Floats.description: Issues with CSS floats or left/right aligned images. For example, bugs with the 'float' and 'clear' properties belong here.

Mozilla Reps.description: The Mozilla Reps, or ReMo, program provides a simple framework and specific tools to help volunteer Mozillians become official representatives of Mozilla in their region.

Planning.description: Bugs related to the deployment of Mozilla Reps infrastructure. More info: https://wiki.mozilla.org/ReMo/Planning

Add-on.description: The Mozilla Reps Companion add-on. Easy access to tools, documentation, and more for Mozilla Reps. (more info)

Swag Requests.description: Requests for swag that can be filled by any Bugzilla account.

Budget Requests.description:
Requests for budget that can be filled by any Bugzilla
account.

reps.mozilla.org.description: Used to track any issues and development of Mozilla Reps website.

Community IT Requests.description: Requests for Hosting and Domains for Mozilla Communities

NSS.description: Network Security Services - a cross-platform security library (more info)

Libraries.description:
Libraries for client support of SSL v2 and v3, TLS, PKCS #5,
PKCS #7, PKCS #11, PKCS #12, S/MIME, X.509 v3 certificates,
and other security standards

CA Certificates.description: Root CA certificates built into NSS shared libraries.

Test.description: The QA test programs and the test driver scripts.

Viewer App.description: This is the viewer test app. utilized by Gecko engineers to test the layout engine.

GFX: OS/2.description: Mapping of cross platform rendering interfaces to OS/2 platform APIs.

Java APIs to WebShell.description: This component is for bugs against the Java API wrapper around WebShell.

GFX: Xlib.description: Mapping of cross platform rendering interfaces to Xlib platform APIs.

Printing: Xprint.description: For bugs in Mozilla's X11 print system. Bugs in the postscript print system should be filed on the Printing Component and not here.

Cmd-line Features.description:
For problems with command line parameter handling.

Examples: mozilla -console doesn't work. mozilla -ProfileManager doesn't work. mozilla -turbo doesn't work.

GFX: Win32.description: Mapping of cross platform rendering interfaces to Windows platform APIs.

Talkback Client.description:
Problems related to the Full Circle client.

Problems with the server software should be filed in mozilla.org:Talkback.

GFX: Mac.description: Mapping of cross platform rendering interfaces to Mac platform APIs.

Installer: MFCEmbed.description:
The MFCEmbed installer installs MFCEmbed files and calls the GRE
installer. In addition to providing a testable MFCEmbed, it serves as a test
case for the GRE installer in its role as a client of other installers.

GFX: Gtk.description: Mapping of cross platform rendering interfaces to GTK platform APIs (both versions).

Ports: Qt.description: Bugs that occur only in the Qt version of Mozilla, but not in other versions like the Gtk one. Sample Bugs: Printing does not work in the Qt port; Images don't show in the Qt port. Unless you know it's a Qt bug, don't file your bug here!

Widget: Xlib.description: Mapping of cross platform widget interfaces to Xlib platform APIs.

QuickLaunch (AKA turbo mode).description:
For bugs related to the QuickLaunch installer
option and preference, which keeps the application resident in memory after all windows are closed, to speed subsequent component loading.

View Source.description: For issues concerning the source window for web pages. Examples of appropriate bugs: menu items in the view source window aren't working, unable to wrap lines in source window, coloring in source window is broken, etc. However, bugs dealing with the HTML Source tab in Composer and lower-level parsing issues do NOT belong here.

Java-Implemented Plugins.description: For bugs against the support for Plugins that are written in Java. This is not OJI, nor the Java Plugin (formerly known as Activator).

Embedding: ActiveX Wrapper.description: This is the ActiveX wrapper that is used when people want to embed Gecko in their application on Windows, instead of using IE as the embedded HTML control.

Image: Painting.description: Bugs related to the rendering or drawing of images Use the Imagelib Component for issues with decoding.

Java: Live Connect.description: LiveConnect is bridging code that connects the standard JavaScript API's with Java API's to provide interlanguage calling. Through LiveConnect Java can access and call objects in JavaScript and JavaScript can access and call public methods and data in Java objects.

Embedding: GTK Widget.description: A GTK widget that allows the embedding of Mozilla into GTK applications.

GFX: BeOS.description: Mapping of cross platform rendering interfaces to BeOS platform APIs.

GFX.description: Cross platform rendering interfaces and cross platform base implementations. Bugs that belong in this component are cross-platform problems with painting, such as fonts getting cropped or underlines not getting correctly removed with dynamic effects. Bugs like this that only occur on one platform belong in the appropriate component listed below.

Widget: Mac.description: Mapping of cross platform widget interfaces to Mac platform APIs.

Error Console.description: The Error Console displays errors, warnings and messages from various components including but not limited to JavaScript, DOM, XML, and CSS. This component is for problems with the Console itself and not for browser or web page problems that are noted in the console.

Installer: GRE.description:
Installer that is called by client products' installers requiring
GRE. Manages issues related to installing GRE as a shared set of files.

Skinability.description:
Issues dealing with Theme Switching and the infrastructure/plumbing of skins. This subsumes the "skins" keyword.

Example: Issues with the Themes Preference Panel, switching from one Theme to another, and skin interaction.

Java APIs for DOM.description: A Java implementation of the Core DOM Level 1 Specification. This API allows Java Applets to access and manipulate the Gecko DOM.

GFX: Photon.description: Mapping of cross platform rendering interfaces to Photon platform APIs.

Camino Graveyard.description: Camino is a native Mac OS X browser-only project (more info)

OS Integration.description: For issues with integrating Camino with Mac OS X. For example: Services.

Page Layout.description: For issues with page layout, i.e., problems with the web content area (except for form elements).

Printing.description: For problems in printing with Camino.

Plug-ins.description: For bugs concerning plug-ins. For example: QuickTime, Flash, etc.

Security.description:
For app-level security bugs.

If the problem relates to underlying components (PSM, NSS, Core) then please file it in the appropriate product instead of here.

Product Site.description: Product pages relating to Camino on the Camino Web Site.

Tabbed Browsing.description: For issues with the tabbed browser feature in Camino.

General.description: For issues in Camino that don't fit into other Camino components.

Accessibility.description: For issues dealing with keyboard navigation (e.g., shortcuts) and focus within Camino.

Annoyance Blocking.description: Issues with the built-in pop-up blocking and ad-blocking controls.

HTML Form Controls.description: For issues with HTML forms in Camino.

Downloading.description: For issues with downloading files in Camino, as well as opening files with helper applications.

Toolbars & Menus.description: For issues with Camino's toolbars, the menubar and context menus.

Translations.description:
For Translation issues concerning camino. Misspelled words,
incorrect use of names, text not translated in specific languages, UI glitches.

Drag & Drop.description: For issues with dragging and dropping items (e.g., links, files, etc) to, from and within Camino.

Bookmarks.description: For bugs in Camino bookmark handling.

Location Bar & Autocomplete.description: For problems with the Location field, as well as the autocompletion feature in Camino.

MailNews Core.description: Mail and news components common to Thunderbird and SeaMonkey

Networking: POP.description: Problems with receiving mail when your mail account is set up for POP. This component should be chosen if you've verified that the receiving problem is specific to POP protocol. Deleting messages to the trash folder would also fall into this component.

Attachments.description: For problems with mail or news message attachments.

Networking: NNTP.description: Problems with reading, posting, or subscribing to newsgroups (also sometimes referred to as USENET)

Simple MAPI.description:
File a bug against this component for problems when using the
simple MAPI feature. This feature allows a non-messaging application to perform messaging operations, such as send, address, and receive messages.

Search.description: Problems with the mail/news search backend

Movemail.description: Problems with getting mail from the user's spool file. (/var/spool/mail/*). This is UNIX only.

LDAP Integration.description: Problems with LDAP functionality that relate to mail/news components. For example, performing LDAP queries in the addressbook, LDAP typedown addressing/autocompletion, and LDAP preferences.

Printing.description: Problems with printing mail messages and address book cards.

Internationalization.description: Internationalization is the process of designing and developing a software product to function in multiple locales. This process involves identifying the locales that must be supported, designing features which support those locales, and writing code needed.

Composition.description:
Problems with the writing a new email or replying to one including using the autocomplete feature. Generally, problems found are within the compose window before sending a message. A few examples: 1. User interface and functionality problems with the html compose window and the plain text compose 
window. 2. Problems with addressing a mail message or adding an attachment.

Security.description:
This component covers all bugs that relate to use of cryptography, S/MIME, and SSL issues for MailNews. Or, use this
component if you have a MailNews security bug.

MIME.description: Problems with parsing the MIME structure and displaying messages. When this problem happens, it's often useful to attach a copy of the mail message generating the problem. If you have Communicator 4.x, you can select the message and save it as an .eml file (just save with the .eml extension). A few examples: 1. The contents of a message do not display properly. Certain items do not show up.

Networking.description: Problems with general networking issues integrating with libnet. For specific protocol problems, please choose: IMAP, News, POP, or SMTP from the list.

Testing Infrastructure.description:
Bugs relating to the testing infrastructure that is specific to
the mailnews code, e.g. xpcshell-tests, fake servers.

Database.description: Problems with underlying code in storage of address book content and mail/news summary files. If the problem you are encountering is with the user interface of the address book or of accessing mail, then this component should not be chosen.

Feed Reader.description: For bugs in MailNews Feed Reader featureset

Security: S/MIME.description: S/MIME is the sending of signed and/or encrypted email.

Profile Migration.description:
Problems with migrating your profile from Communicator 4.x to the current Mozilla mail. Choose this component if you've verified that the problem you are seeing does not occur when you 
create a new profile and add the mail or news account you were using with migration.

Localization.description: Localization is the process of adapting software for a specific international market; this process includes translating the user interface, resizing dialog boxes, replacing icons and other culturally sensitive graphics (if necessary) and customizing features.

Networking: IMAP.description:
Problems with receiving mail when your mail account is set up for IMAP. This component should be chosen if you've verified that the receiving problem is specific to IMAP protocol. A 
few examples: 1. Interoperability problems with IMAP servers (i.e. folders, naming conventions) would fall into this 
component. 2. Using the IMAP delete model

Import.description: Import Mail, Import Mail Settings from third party applications. Also, Import Address Book entries and preferences.

Networking: SMTP.description:
Problems with sending mail. If you have specific problems with 
the compose window, you should choose the "Composition" component from the list.

Address Book.description: Problems with the address book backend and shared frontend bits

Filters.description: Problems with using filters to filter your mail. A few examples: 1. User interface and functionality problems with creating, editing, deleting, using filters. 2. Incoming mail is not filtered properly.

Build Config.description: Bugs concerning the comm-central build system and build problems with that repository that are not specific to one of the applications. For example, bugs in mailnews/ Makefiles.

Backend.description: Problems with RDF data sources and application logic. Most likely, your problem can fit in one of the other components so this component should be rarely used.

Account Manager.description: Problems with setting up accounts within MailNews.

Toolkit.description: The Mozilla Toolkit is a set of APIs, built on top of Gecko, which provide advanced services to XUL applications. These services include Profile Management, Chrome Registration, Browsing History, Extension and Theme Management, Application Update Service, and Safe Mode. (More info)

Toolbars and Toolbar Customization.description: Widgets for toolbar display and customization.

XUL Widgets.description: For bugs in widgets implemented by the XUL Toolkit

View Source.description: For issues concerning the source window for web pages.

Security.description:
For toolkit security bugs.

If the problem relates to underlying components (PSM, NSS, Core), or a specific product built upon toolkit and not this layer then please file it in the appropriate product instead of here.

General.description: For bugs in Toolkit code that don't fit into any of the other components.

Help Viewer.description: Use this component to report problems with the Help Viewer used in toolkit apps like Firefox. Examples: topics won't load in the Help Viewer, or the Back button doesn't work in the Help Viewer.

Form Manager.description: The component that captures user data appearing on a form and autofills that data on other forms.

Build Config.description: For bugs in Toolkit build and config

Password Manager.description: For bugs in the Firefox feature that remembers usernames and passwords on sites and prefills them when the user returns to the site.

Application Update.description: Application update for Firefox, Thunderbird, and Sunbird.

Spatial Navigation.description: Spatial navigation allows you to change the focus of a web page using directional keys (Up, Down, Left, Right).

about:memory.description: This component implements Firefox's about:memory page.

Startup and Profile System.description: New applications startup system - including shared AppRunner, AppStartup, and profile system.

Forget About Site.description: Bugs and feature requests for the Forget About This Site feature.

Places.description: Manages the user's history, bookmarks, livemarks and annotations. This component is for bugs in the Places APIs, database tables, and code used to access Places data.

Telemetry.description: Telemetry allows Engineering to receive aggregate data of browser health in the field.

Printing.description: Print Preview and other toolkit elements of printing.

Breakpad Integration.description: Breakpad crash reporting library - exception handler and crash report sender application.

Download Manager.description: Bugs and feature requests for Firefox downloading.

Add-ons Manager.description: The management and update windows for extensions and themes (add-ons).

Video/Audio Controls.description:
For problems related to the default controls used in HTML 5 media
elements (<video> and <audio>).

OS.File.description: For bugs in Mozilla's JavaScript OS.File module. This does not cover the DOM File API. If you are filing a bug related to file I/O but you are not sure whether the underlying module is OS.File, please use component Networking: File

Error Console.description: The Error Console displays errors, warnings and messages from various components including but not limited to JavaScript, DOM, XML, and CSS. This component is for problems with the Console itself and not for browser or web page problems that are noted in the console.

Plugin Finder Service.description:
For bugs in the Plugin Finder Service, which searches for missing
plugins and installs them.

Storage.description: SQLite-backed generic data storage and query engine.

Tech Evangelism.description: For reporting web pages that need to be upgraded to support web standards and Gecko-based browsers. And for reporting add-ons that exhibit common problems that make Firefox run sub-optimally. (more info)

Chinese-Simplified.description: Evangelism bugs for sites in Simplified Chinese GB2312. Use (Simplified) Chinese GB2312 encoding when writing comments in Chinese.

Afrikaans.description: Evangelism bugs for sites in Afrikaans

Icelandic.description: Evangelism bugs for sites in Icelandic

Marathi.description: Evangelism bugs for sites in Marathi

Chinese-Traditional.description: Evangelism bugs for sites in Traditional Chinese Big5. Use (Traditional) Chinese Big5 encoding when writing comments in Chinese.

Dutch.description: Evangelism bugs for sites in Dutch

Sinhala.description: Evangelism bugs for sites in Sinhala

Add-ons.description: Evangelism bugs for add-ons that exhibit common problems that make Firefox run sub-optimally. Note that ordinary add-on bugs should not be filed here, but should be filed with the add-on's own bug tracker.

Rhino.description: An implementation of JavaScript in Java (more info)

E4X.description: ECMAScript for XML (E4X) ECMA-357 a set of programming language extensions adding native XML support to ECMAScript.

Compiler.description: Java classfile generation and command-linecompiler tool.

Core.description: Core JavaScript parsing, interpreter, runtime, and interactive shell.

AUS.description: The Application Update Service is used by client software to check for updates to application software.

General.description: General

API.description: The API for integration with other systems (build, webapps, etc.).

Infrastructure & Operations.description: Server and networking infrastructure, including web properties, CDN, DNS (more info)

NetOps: Office Carrier.description: Office carrier installs, upgrades, outages, etc

Infrastructure: Tools.description: Issues related to internal tools and bots

Infrastructure: Puppet.description: Issues and requests relating to puppet

WebOps: Product Delivery.description: Any apps directly related to installing or updating key products - typically Bedrock, AUS, Bouncer, FTP, and associated CDN properties.

WebOps: Engagement.description: Community Engagement projects, like Affiliates, Firefox Flicks, Mozilla Reps, etc.

NetOps: Office Other.description: All other office related bugs not related to ACLs, wireless, or carriers

WebOps: Inventory.description: Development and operations bugs relating to inventory.mozilla.org.

Infrastructure: Mail.description: Issues regarding mail but not Zimbra

Infrastructure: OpenVPN.description: Anything related to the OpenVPN infrastructure at Mozilla

WebOps: Bugzilla.description: Bugs specifically pertaining to operational issues on bugzilla.mozilla.org (BMO).

NetOps: Office ACL Requests.description: Office firewall flows and ACL requests

RelOps.description: IT requests related to deploying and managing the RelEng infrastructure.

WebOps: Source Control.description: Bugs pertaining to the operation of Mozilla's SVN, CVS, Hg, Git, or BZR systems.

NetOps: Other.description: Internal outage tracking and bugs without a more suitable component

NetOps: DC Other.description: All other data center bugs not related to ACLs, port configurations, or carriers

WebOps: Community Platform.description: SUMO, MDN, Input, and related projects.

RelOps: Puppet.description: Bugs and enhancements directly related to PuppetAgain, the release engineering configuration management system.

Infrastructure: LDAP.description: Issues regarding the corporate OpenLDAP infrastructure at Mozilla

Infrastructure: DNS.description: Issues relating to internal and external DNS services

NetOps: DC Carrier.description: Data center carrier installs, upgrades, outages, etc

WebOps: IT-Managed Tools.description: Web Applications that are provided directly be Mozilla IT. Inventory, blog.mozilla.org, wiki.mozilla.org, etherpad.mozilla.org, Sentry/errormill, Logstash/Bunker, etc.

Boot2Gecko Graveyard.description: For bugs in old components that aren't active anymore.

MozillaClassic.description: For bugs about the Mozilla web browser before M3. You cannot file bugs in this component.

Preferences.description: Please see libPref, Pref UI or Profile Mgr components under Browser product for bugs against Preferences.

Calendar.description: These bugs used to live in the Calendar Product
